org.cojen.tupl.repl

Interface MessageReplicator.Writer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable, DirectReplicator.Accessor, DirectReplicator.Writer
    Enclosing interface:
    MessageReplicator

    public static interface MessageReplicator.Writer
extends DirectReplicator.Writer
    Interface called by the group leader for proposing messages. When consensus has been reached, the messages are committed and become available for all members to read.
    See Also:
    newWriter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default boolean writeMessage(byte[] message)
      Write a single message to the log.
      default boolean writeMessage(byte[] message, int offset, int length)
      Write a single message to the log.
      boolean writeMessage(byte[] message, int offset, int length, boolean finished)
      Write a single message to the log, as part of an atomic batch.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.cojen.tupl.repl.DirectReplicator.Writer

        commitIndex, uponCommit, uponEndCommit, waitForCommit, waitForEndCommit

      • Methods inherited from interface org.cojen.tupl.repl.DirectReplicator.Accessor

        close, index, term, termEndIndex, termStartIndex

    • Method Detail

      • writeMessage

        default boolean writeMessage(byte[] message)
                      throws IOException
        Write a single message to the log.
        Returns:
        false only if the writer is deactivated
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeMessage

      • writeMessage

        boolean writeMessage(byte[] message,
                     int offset,
                     int length,
                     boolean finished)
              throws IOException
        Write a single message to the log, as part of an atomic batch. When read back, all messages in the batch are separate from each other.
        Parameters:
        finished - pass true for the last message in the batch
        Returns:
        false only if the writer is deactivated
        Throws:
        IOException
